questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 tenant.
You plan to create a retention policy as shown in the following exhibit.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You implement sensitivity labels for your company.
You need to automatically protect email messages that contain the word Confidential in the subject line.
What should you create?

choices.C: a mail flow rule from the Exchange admin center
choices.D: a data loss prevention (DLP) policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center
choices.A: a SecOps mailbox from the Microsoft 365 Defender portal
choices.B: a sharing policy from the Exchange admin center

discussion.content:
The idiots below me don't know what they're talking about...

D. a data loss prevention (DLP) policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center

To automatically protect email messages that contain specific sensitive information, such as the word "Confidential" in the subject line, you would need to create a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policy from the Microsoft 365 compliance center. DLP policies allow you to identify, monitor, and protect sensitive information across Microsoft 365 services, including Exchange Online.

Selected Answer: C
By "protect" do they mean encrypt? If so, then C

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/define-mail-flow-rules-to-encrypt-email?view=o365-worldwide

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains 500 Windows 11 devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune.
You deploy a new Win32 app named App1 to all the devices and verify that users can install App1 manually by using the Company Portal app.
You need to configure App1 to ensure that all future deployments of the app install automatically without user intervention. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Needed setup of Assignment is Required.

Selected Answer: C
Assignment needs to be set. 
Needed setup of Assignment is Required.

Selected Answer: C
Anser C is for sure CORRECT!
When you edit or create a new app you will see in the assignment options the subtitle "Required". This forces an installment of the application. Just add the group there and you are good to go.

Selected Answer: C
Available to Required in assignments

Selected Answer: C
Yes, C seems like the best option here.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct!

On Assignments page you change users/groups/devices from "Avaliable" to "Required".

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
c seems correct

comments.content:
Agree.
On Assignments page you change users/groups/devices from "Avaliable" to "Required".

choices.A: Modify the detection rules for App1.
choices.B: Delete App1, and then redeploy App1.
choices.D: Modify the install command for App1.

questions.question_text:
You have a new Microsoft 365 E5 tenant.

You need to enable an alert policy that will be triggered when an elevation of Microsoft Exchange Online administrative privileges is detected.

What should you do first?
